intro: Racosperma obtusifolium, commonly known as the broad-leaved acacia, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant features bipinnate leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets. It produces yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which attract pollinators such as bees and birds. Racosperma obtusifolium is adapted to dry environments and is often found in sandy or rocky soils.
